page.title: 17LOCAL NEWS : ROAD ACCIDENT
page.content: On Friday June 14th.1985 at about 7.30 pm. Darrel Bailey, aged 16 from Vinebank Rd. was riding his B.M.X when he collided with a white Ford. The accident happened outside his own home. Several people witnessed the accident and his mother was soon called out. Darrel had serious injuries including a leg fracture, broken collar bone and a broken arm. At first he was in a coma and an ambulance took him to the North Staffs. Royal Infirmary where he is now sitting up in bed. Darrel is an ex-pupil of Dove Bank Primary School and has just left Maryhill Comprehensive. He has got to stay in hospital for a long time. BY GLENIS MOLLART, AGED 11 YEARS
